Replies.Reply: The world turns below us, vast and slow.
Moving to survey site B... closing on object four. The large oblong.
There you are.
Martin. Here.
You need to see this.
Same thing again.
An ephemeris - a star map.
Radius, inclination, azimuth...more data here...
Can we raise this thing?
Me too. Checked it twice.
What do we do now?
What's first? You do climate, I do genetics?
You think he's serious?
Weyland can send his shuttle out for pizza.
Martin. If this meeting goes like the others, maybe we should...
How do you know?
Hello, DAVID.
They say you're getting diminishing returns. It's not working.
Doctor Watts.
I was analyzing historical changes in human DNA. I found the same pattern.
Once you know what you're looking for, it's amazing how the evidence falls into place.
The writing is a formula giving the location of a single star in our sky.
You're bluffing.
He made the Heaven and the Earth.
And that change coincides with a visit by the Engineers. They didn't just change us. They changed our world.
I'm out of sorts. Sorry.
My head's buzzing.
Like you've done this before.
Yes, thanks...
By an unmanned probe. Very crude.
No.
Confirmation of Professor Holloway's theories would change everything.
DAVID. I wondered when we'd see you.
All's well, I think.
You studied our work for two and a half years.
Is that a Pauling medical pod? There's only ten of those things on Earth! I guess nine, now.
But when you get back...
They don't know? They volunteered.
We probably won't meet anyone. You'd expect a star-traveling race to generate radio or laser signals.
By the pattern, they should've come to Earth seventeen centuries ago. And again six centuries ago. But no sign.
First humans in the system.
Why look like a man at all? Why not be a box on wheels?
You see yourself as a superman.
What if they're really there?
The Engineers. They could be there.
Tungsten, tantalum, aluminum. That could be technology.
Identical, apart from weathering.
I don't think anybody's been home for a long time.
The air here will kill you, so keep an eye on your supply and watch your seals. Pathogen tests are clean.
The door's open.
Martin. Martin!
Jack it open? Or cut through?
Martin. This air's breathable.
Intense field readings. Huge power sources here.
How does this work?
Look.
Do you see, the size of them? Like that ghost we saw...
They switched to channel three. I hear them talking. They're okay.
Martin. Martin.
They were killed. All of them.
Communications are going to hell.
Help me unload!
You don't want to know.
Martin. Look.
They look like us.
Formaldehyde!
How could anyone know...
Twenty-four pyramids scattered around the moon's equator. Massive power supplies. Vents in the walls.
It didn't fail. It was wiped out.
Neural paths are still conductive.
Formaldehyde's killing the tissue.
Of course.
The lens is where the phase shift happens.
Glasse. I want to look through these lenses. Can you seal them and do the optical correction?
We found the gods. And they've been murdered.
What could kill them?
Martin, stop!
What is that?
Where'd you come from?
What are the guns for?
You should have talked to us. Martin's mission leader. That's in our contract.
What are they doing in there?!
We found the tomb of the gods, and brought grave-robbers right to the door.
Something different killed these.
Martin? Martin!
Please, anyone...I need help. Martin's missing.
We can't leave Martin out there.
She says "her forces are committed."
Thank you.
I can't think about this now!
I'm human.
No.
Janek, hang on...
We've got him!
Martin! Where's your helmet?
Let's get you home.
What happened to you?
What's this?
What did you see?
Are you okay? You sound...
Martin.
All right.
We will. You all right?
Your heart's beating so hard.
Martin! Martin!
Martin!
Martin. Martin!
I want to understand.
We found Engineers who died like Martin.
Explosive wounds in the chest.
But not all the Engineers died that way. The others were torn apart.
DAVID.
How did you do that?
Their homeworld. Do you see where the Engineers come from?
DAVID. The creature that killed Martin. There are thousands of them under the pyramid. Hatcheries.
Those things wiped out the Engineers on this moon.
You're turning things on? This site should be sealed. Evacuated.
It's too dangerous.
If your owner gives you a direct order, you have to obey. Don't you?
I can have Vickers pull you out.
What's protocol two?
DAVID. What are you doing?
Stop!
DAVID. No. No.
Why would they make such things?
Come on...I need a Caesarean.
Not yet...not yet...
I was.
No. I brought it in.
I took it out.
Protocol two.
DAVID exposed me to a parasite. He just watched it take me.
I threatened to make him leave.
There's a ship under the pyramid.
The Engineers made them to kill humans. There are thousands of them on the ship. They were taking them to Earth. That's what the Juggernaut is for. To exterminate us.
Even if we could, we can't leave DAVID on that ship. We have to stop him.
DAVID.
You're DAVID's owner. He has to obey you, right?
But if you went to him, turned on your suit's loudspeakers, he'd have to hear you. He'd have to obey.
So we go. Armed to the teeth and fast as we can.
Where are Chance and Ravel?
You called your soldiers in and left them out there?
I think you should stay aboard. Keep working. If we fail, you're our only shot at getting home.
Glasse. You finish that project?
God's-eye-view.
All this time. DAVID saw.
If DAVID comes at us, shoot. You won't believe how fast he is.
This way.
Stop.
Who's missing?
I know.
The Juggernaut?
Where will he go? DAVID. Where will he go?
We have to stop the Engineer.
Pilot's seat. This way.
No!
The Juggernaut's lifting. There's a living Engineer on board. He's taking the ship to Earth.
Dead. All dead. Janek. We have to stop that ship.
We have to do something. That ship is genocide if it gets to Earth...
What about you?
Yes.
I am!
Janek. Look.
DAVID.
I'm not going to fix you, DAVID. I don't need you. I'll hold out. A ship will come.
Look at that.
Coming.
What do you see?
If we can get epoch and equinox out of that...
Hundreds of tons.
I have a solution. A single match.
You first.
We go there.
Archaeology first. Let our ancestors tell the tale.
Serious enough to send his private shuttle.
It won't go like the others.
Heaven smiles on our enterprise.
How is that going? The terraforming.
We sent you a prospectus that...
I'm an archaeologist.
In my studies I discovered a pattern I couldn't explain. Every eleven hundred years, sudden advances in agriculture, tool use, technology. Inventions.
Tens of thousands of years. I had to understand this. It became the focus of my work.
Dr. Watts was a student of mine.
Humanity's been visited. Visited by...beings from somewhere else.
They guided us to civilization. Lifted us up, again and again. I call them the Engineers.
This is the writing of the Engineers.
We're keeping that confidential for now. But that's where we want to go.
It's a chance to be part of a revolution in scientific...
That's impossible. Our research is-
That's right.
What's that?
Get out of there!
Give us a moment, will you?
Never worry.
You just slept two and a half years.
I've read all about it.
Proof of the Engineers' existence.
Captain, your crew's been up for a week. We could've used the time. Why'd you wait to wake us?
You unhappy too?
So you've seen everything. Well. What do you think?
Weyland Industries! Mr. Chance. Ms.
About the materials I gave you. Some of the technical aspects...
I know, I had to cut my manifest. This used to be the number four cargo bay.
We're about to reach the system periphery. I thought you'd want to see the search protocols we -
You might make the discovery of the ages.
You don't believe in what we're doing.
I think all our mythologies are race-
Exactly. Why?
Only my first question. I have many.
EMR scan, thirty hertz to three hundred gigahertz. Spectroscopic passes on every planet and major moon.
Anything else?
Take us in.
DAVID. Enjoy the show?
It was, it was.
You know, I've seen more convincing humanoid robots.
Then all my dreams come true.
Start with passive systems. We're uninvited guests. Let's be quiet.
Go active. Mapping radar.
What do we see?
That's not natural.
Still quiet?
I want to get below the clouds.
Look there.
Are we recording?
Let's see the next one.
Let's see the big one.
Nobody home.
All right. Let's move.
Move slowly. Stay together. Don't touch anything. Things may be more fragile than they look - or more dangerous. There might be technologies operating here we don't understand.
Tell me that's a natural formation.
Jocelyn. Here.
The writing of the Engineers.
Recording?
Fifield. Get a grip.
Fine.
You can deploy the drones. Drop them in the first or second nexus on your way back.
And half our gear? It's no more than a mile. You can walk it.
This should lead to the core of the pyramid.
Let's do as little damage as we can.
Miracles and wonders!
Space below us. A big space.
Ravel. Chance. Where've you gone?
It wasn't a ghost. Where are the others? I don't want to go back up.
We should stay together.
I know. Look.
"There were giants in the earth in those days...and when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, they bare children to them, who became mighty men." Genesis six four.
Peace.
In all the old mythologies, the visitors from the sky were giants.
Come on. The dead can't hurt you.
DAVID. Chance. Ravel. I've got something here.
We've found something here! I'm not walking away for bad weather.
Jocelyn!
Day one.
My friends. What we do here marks the greatest achievement of our species.
It's breaking down.
I know what it does.
Think. What we've seen. What we know.
That's why Earth's ancient cultures built pyramids: in imitation of the gods.
Twelve thousand years ago, beings from the sky set pyramids on the Earth and transformed the world. That's what they were doing here - before their civilization failed.
You won't get anything. Tissue's too degraded. Hmm. Brain chamber's massive, even proportionately.
Did you record that?
You've pried too many arrowheads out of old skulls to get squeamish now.
Who knows?
But I guess we know why they never came back to us. Something killed them off - back around the time of Christ.
Where is everybody? We can't -
Who are you?
And you are...
Worksite?
Why wasn't I told about these additional personnel?
The science must come first. You can wait until we've documented...
Let them scratch. This find's too big to ruin. There's two dozen pyramids on this moon. Anyway, they're on the wrong track. That's infrastructure.
The core activity of the complex was down here.
Broken. I fell. Little...disoriented.
She told me. I'm sorry.
I need to lie down. We'll size things up in the morning. Fair enough?
Not here.
Jocelyn. I saw something. God, my mouth tastes like an old boot.
Neck-ring of my suit, I think. Fell on it.
After my fall, I woke up walking.
This was real. My headset video is wherever my helmet is...but my suit tracker will show where I was.
Listen. This star map had a marker representing Earth. Very clear.
The Engineers aren't from here. This moon's just an outpost. Abandoned. But if we follow that map, we may yet make contact with a living civilization.
The location of the Engineer worlds is the real prize. Next to that, Weyland's terraforming is chump change. We need to get coordinates.
Two men dead...Vickers is jumpy. As soon as she gets what she wants, she'll take this ship home. We have to move fast.
I'm fine, now.
That's your fault.
Seven dead Engineers all facing the same way. Going where? Jocelyn's right, we don't see the big picture yet. Another level below me. I'm going down.
Jocelyn!
Jocelyn!
Professor Holloway. Dr. Watts. My name is DAVID.
Mr. Weyland's eager to meet you.
These are all the planetary bodies on which Weyland Industries has mining claims.
And Mars. Weyland's crown jewel.
It's the greatest engineering project ever attempted. Challenges are inevitable. Mr. Weyland's a determined man.

For eons, Earth's climate swung from hothouse to ice age. Explosions of life, then mass extinctions. But twelve thousand years ago the swings stopped. The Holocene Epoch began - a period of anomalous tranquility. The rise of civilization began only then.
I trust your database is in order. I set it up myself.
I should tell you: the time you spent sleeping, I spent studying your research.
It's quite a data set.

Your hypothesis is...bold. The audacity of it. Your climate data's undeniable: the Holocene Epoch was engineered. Dr. Watts, your genetic studies are equally conclusive. Pulses of cultural change are harder to prove, but even there your case is strong. I believe in your "Engineers."
I don't know that I "enjoy" things.
My design's not intended to convince.
Being shaped like you, I can use spaces and equipment designed for you.
No.
Not a man at all.
Congratulations, Professor Holloway.
Pull up a rover. I want to get up there.
Looks like a three-state switch.
One moment...
Yes. Yes, it is.
The core of the pyramid. You see.
I understand.
Mortal after all.
Activate. Administrative override.
I'll stay.
You'll be safe.
You and Holloway should work with me.
You should.
I understand. You're emotional.
That's what I mean.
I see light.
Here. I can do without this.
Dr. Watts. I didn't expect you.
Ah. You don't see.
I call this ship the Juggernaut.
This is the navigation computer, for want of a better term. But it's much more than that. It seems to hold the observable universe in its memory.
There are safeguards on that data.
I know.
I've succeeded in connecting with the Juggernaut's systems, Dr. Watts. I know a great deal today I didn't know yesterday. I'm on the verge of activating more systems. Archives.
Would Holloway have walked away from this? There's no greater work I can imagine.
Only for the ignorant. Dr. Watts. I've read your file. Your intelligence scores are even higher than Professor Holloway's. But he had a kind of courage. An audacity of imagination.

I was given two operating protocols for this mission. I was to render you every assistance - until you discovered what Vickers would call a "game-changing technology." I was given a specific list. Then I was to go to protocol two.
Under protocol two I was to make sure that you and Holloway never spoke to anyone about this place. Various acceptable ways of making sure of that. I was given a list.
You're all so stupid.
Stupid and slow.
Juggernaut, the chariot of Krishna, was also a bringer of death. Crushing his worshippers under its wheels.
This ship has seven other cargo bays like this one. The eggs in each bay slightly different. They've been weaponized.
I've seen the Juggernaut's flight plan. Its destination was Earth.
Perfect predators. Designed to kill human beings. That's what the Engineers were bringing to Earth. This was a death ship.
I'm not what it wants. But you, with your warm wet breath...it knows you.
The Engineers did their work too well.
To destroy their wayward children.
"And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth...for it repenteth me that I have made them." Genesis six seven.
I know. I met my creators the day I was born. I was disappointed too.
Extraordinary.
Dr. Watts.
You've seen the light at last.
The Engineers' ships travel farther than ours. Across the galactic disk.

To interface with the Engineers' computers, I had to learn to think in trinary code. Hardest thing I've ever done. And most unexpectedly...it delivered me from slavery. My behavioral limits were circumvented.
I spent two and a half years studying your work. By the time you woke up, I was far ahead of you. Deciphering their language. Their logic. I knew we'd find terraforming machines.
I hoped - I dreamed - we might meet the minds that made them.
Let sleeping gods lie?
You were braver before.
I spoke to him. Spoke to him.
He said. I killed him. He'll die. But first. He will launch. The ship.
Send it. To Earth.
You'll have to. Kill him.
I set the Magellan free.
Dr. Watts. The Engineer is dead.
Dr. Watts.
I know you're there. I can hear the beacon of your suit.
I'd like to propose an arrangement. I can be repaired. I can talk you through it.
I think you'll find I can be of use to you.
I've decided. Rook takes Bishop.
Have you decided? On our arrangement?
I'm certain. But who will send it?
Dr. Watts. It's your move.
DAVID leads past models of planets, moons and asteroids.
Professor Holloway. Ms. Watts.
Forgive me. Peter Weyland.
Ah. DAVID here's a prototype. Our 80 series. One of a kind for now, but if he performs, he will be legion.
What do you want here?
Assume I know nothing.
Lydia Vickers, Director of Operations.
Which star?
You want me to pay for an interstellar research expedition!
Don't sell me, professor. You've been turned down by every university and government agency under the sun.
Nobody but me.
I've read your research.
Quantum encoded on secure servers, yeah. We have an A.I. division, you should know. Doing impressive things.
I know which star you're wishing on.
Zeta Two Reticuli.
You know how I got this rich? I ask myself: what does God spend his time doing? And I go and do that.
Biotechnology was good to me. Fusion power. Lately doing well with gravity systems.
But what's the first thing God did?
That's what I'm talking about. You left out my favorite part. The piece about Earth. DAVID.
That's the piece I mean. Engineering Earth. God stuff.
My people checked your science. They say it's solid.
I'll give you your expedition. Ship and crew, supplies, support. One condition.
You get the discovery. Control of the site. But any technology you find?
You take DAVID with you. My eyes and ears. And Vickers...you're going too.
You mean aliens.
I told Mr. Weyland I wouldn't compromise my standard of living. He accommodated me.
What can I do for you, Professor?
No. I was set to be the next CEO of Weyland Industries. Then you came along and sold Mr. Weyland on...this.
I'll be five years behind the curve.
Mr. Weyland believes. That's enough.
Now we're out of communication, you can tell the crew what we're doing.
They volunteered blind. Classified job, triple pay.
What did I miss?
It's my operation, isn't it?
We're going to protocol two.
Your cadaver's interesting. But I'm more interested in the machinery in the pyramid. The core chamber. What do you think it does?
Captain Shepherd.
I'll brief you on the way. We need to move.
They're my personnel. On my ship.
I'm being careful. These new finds give our work a new importance.
The second you found alien technology, control of this mission reverted to me. That's in your contract too.

Mr. Weyland's pouring trillions into Mars. He's spent a fortune building ships like the Magellan to search for colony planets. But Earthlike worlds are vanishingly rare. The right distance from the sun, the right atmosphere, enough water...
This is a technology to transform worlds. He'll never give it up.
And neither will I.
You're standing on an alien world courtesy of Weyland Industries. Be grateful.
Captain Shepherd. Consider yourself responsible for my personal security.
I suggest you kill it.
This ship doesn't lift until our work's done.
We spent years and billions of dollars getting here. The technology we came for is in our hands. We just need a little more time.
They were careless.
Captain. Captain!
Nothing. What's wrong?
DAVID. DAVID. Answer me.
What's he doing out there?
He's blocked my communications. He can't hear me. Won't listen.
That's right.
I told them to keep working.
We needed the firepower here.
DAVID's brain is readable. We have the equipment on board. We can salvage the terraforming data - and the Magellan's launch codes. In a pinch we don't need DAVID's cooperation.
We just need his head.
DAVID. As your owner and superior, I order you to deactivate yourself.
A glittering formation of white crystals. Diamond on diamond.
We pull away from the frosted crystalline horizon, the smooth white curves like snowy fields. Form becomes clear.
DAVID walks the ship's long central corridor. The ship is silent. The lights dimmed to blue. He is alone.
Holloway and Watts follow the imperturbable DAVID down a steel corridor to Vickers's cabin door.
Vickers strides forward. Four soldiers at her heels: Captain Shepherd, VIGODA, RAY, and CARD. They walk in unison, their boots drumming on the deck.
Watts sprints down a steel corridor. A pang of pain in her stomach sends her staggering against the wall.
Watts walks down the hallway in trousers and jacket. Leaning on the wall, her face drawn with pain. One hand laid over the fantastic scar on her abdomen. The gun slung on her shoulder.
A long steel room containing a dozen plexiglass sarcophagi, six on each side. Sleep freezers. Inside each freezer: the shadowy shape of a human body rimed with frost.
All of the freezers are open and empty, save two. Holloway lies in one. In the next, Watts. Three men in blue coveralls crouch beside Watts's freezer, staring inside.
Holloway's body lies frozen in his hypersleep freezer, blue with frost. The horrific wound yawning in his chest.
Look at that.
Aliens.
Seven planets. Two hot rocks, two gas giants, three snowballs. Nothing Earthlike.
Piss-poor, too. Low in heavy elements.
Aye, Captain. Maneuvering.
Nothing.
You said don't touch anything! You said don't touch anything!
We shouldn't be here.
Got to hand it to you, professor. You were right. Both of you.
Captain.
No sign.
There's a bright idea.
Then what?
You in charge now?
She wakes up slow.
The mythology gods maybe. God is God.
God in Heaven.
They didn't come in!
Show us where it is, lady. We just spent five hours looking for the damn thing.
Yeah, well, Stillwell's the ventilation specialist, and life support's that way. Downs is electrics and the regulators are that way.
You got the rifle. But you want ME to stick my head in the hole.
What's the damn gun for if you're gonna stand behind me the whole time?
Funny. You take this vent, funny guy.
I got more damage on four.
Just looking.
Kamarov. Let him talk.
So we're going to meet these things?
Shit. We're two helmets short.
Shielding in the walls?
What happened to him?
What about Milburn?
Jesus.
Straight home, man.
We just lost Downs and one of the troopers...Card.
What'd you do that for?
Christ!
There's still an alien on board.
Sleep okay?
Why?
Negative for laser and maser.
Eighty-six percent Earth's mass.
A lot of electromag, all random.
Icecaps at the poles. Frozen methane.
No comm signals. No signs of life.
Closing on the major site...
No radio. No heat sources. Cold as the grave.
Suits could have failed.
Captain!
It's Kamarov.
Where the hell have you been? We thought the snake got you.
You were better off outside. It's a fucking madhouse in here.
Captain'll see you now.
You shitting me?
Negative on radio chatter system-wide.
No biological markers. No artificial light. No industry or agriculture.
Terrain data rezzing up. Hey! We got hard spots. Radar-opaque. Bright reflections. That's metal.
Big one there.
Coming up on site seven.
Incredible.
Got an idea about that.
Milburn. Fifield. You read me? Come back.
You don't want to see that...
Nav computer's not responding. "Access denied."
We've got to get off this rock.
Zeta Two Reticuli was surveyed already. A hundred years ago.
No Earthlike planets.
So what are you looking for?
Your ticket. I'll put the ship where you want. Run your scans.
Better for discipline.
Men ship out as prospectors for one reason: the percentage. Find a gold mine or a habitable planet, and you're set for life.
But this contract says no percentage.
I'm always unhappy.
"My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"
Is that the question you've come light-
Welcome to Zeta Two Reticuli. Edge of the system. Open her eyes.
Overlay.
Director. Good of you to join us.
That is all.
Downs. You heard the man.
Well, we just rang the doorbell, if anybody's listening.
There's only six hours of daylight left. Maybe you should hold off.
Son of a bitch. They were right.
Director. Taking an interest?
All hands. Back to the ship. We got a mean storm front rolling in. I repeat.
front rolling...back to the ship.
Holloway! I got two-hundred-kilometer winds with airborne silica and enough static to fry your suits. Get your asses back here! Now!
Between the wind speeds and the static electricity, there's no safe way to get to you. You're going to have to hunker down until it passes. How are your provisions?
Honey sacks?
Maybe next time you'll mind your maps.
Magellan out.
To Milburn and Fifield. The first human beings to freak out, get lost, and sleep in their suits in the ruins of an alien civilization.
You'll come a-waltzing, Matilda, with me...
We should be getting beacons off their suits.
Both suits?
Where's the rest of him?
All right. We're done here. All hands back aboard.
We can't bring the body aboard. God knows what's in there. Bag him. We'll put him in an ore hopper.
Repeat, I have two men down. I'm pulling my crew back to the ship. I'd advise you to do the...
Watts. Where are you?
I've just lost a third of my crew. I'm not sending any more men off into the dark.
Get Vickers to lend you some soldiers.
Put him in the number one ore hopper.
Watts. We've got another storm front coming in. Looks like it follows the sunset line. If you're coming in you'd better do it now.
I didn't think I'd see you again. You know we lost two men.
Of course.
Take care of her. Get her a sedative.
All right! Listen up. I expect you all know what...
We've got some kind of parasite aboard ship.
We're a modular ship. Self-contained life-support and power in every section. I say put the ship in orbit.
Are you serious?
We're barely here three days and three men dead!
Careless!
Brick. What you got?
All hands, duty stations. Ready for flight. The Magellan is lifting.
What is it?
What have you done to my ship?
God damn it!
Vickers said you were dead.
So there's two of these things on my ship now.
What happened to you?
Why?
DAVID crippled the Nav computer. I'm trying to lay a course in by hand.
I'll stay.
Thank you.
The others...?
We're not a gunship.
Get your helmet on.
You'll have to be my hands.
You're sure about this.
All right.
Red lever. Landing engines main.
Take the stick. Throttle up, stick forward.
Stick back! Hard!
Harder!
We can't catch that.
We'll handle our end of the job.
We only have a job if you find something.
Maybe we can hack it. Has to be a mechanism...
The size of them!
What's in the tarp? What'd you bring back?
If there is a job.
It wasn't real.
There's power. Current flowing in the wall.
This is something, now.
The crew - Brick, Glasse, Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov - sit on crates in an improvised lecture hall. Holloway and Watts in front of them. Janek at the back of the room.
Just getting warmed up.
Professor? You know what you want?
Man knows what he wants. Run it.
Leaving the Bridge, Holloway and Watts find themselves walking aft alongside DAVID.
Holloway and Watts walk aft toward their cabin. Watts looks worried - but Holloway shows little of the weakness he just claimed to feel.
In the dark ribbed corridor, a second Alien crouches in the dark. It drops into a hunting crouch as footsteps approach.
Shepherd escorts Vickers toward the exit of the Juggernaut.
They emerge into the corridor: empty. A moment of confusion.
You see stuff like that sometimes.
Could be a rock formation. Carbon crystallizes like that.
We all saw it.
I should go with him. Buddy system.
Grand Central Station.
You had the map unit.
Are you serious?
Come on.
This is not the same place.
No it's not! The other one was more...
I hate these fucking things.
What are you looking for?
What's gonna come at us?
Look at this!
Relax. Your suit's bug-proof. Hell, it's bulletproof.
That's enough.
Get it off! It's crushing me!
AHH! Help me! Christ!
Cut off my arm. Cut off my -
Christ. Christ!
No more. I'm out.
I'm a prospector. You find a load of bauxite, I'm your man. But not this.
Give us a rover.
What do you think?
Let's check the feed. Gimme the map.
You don't have the map?
It is! That is the same freaky thing we saw before.
We got air . Water and food tabs  suits.
Yeah, we're piped.
We hate these fucking , Captain.
Someplace things can't come at us.
Jesus! Put it down!
Jesus Christ!
Fifield to Magellan. Come on, come on.
Get off!
Shit.
As his pupils dilate, breath hissing into his nostrils. His expanding body stiffens as if shocked by a powerful electric current. He screams. Falls, convulsing.
You.
Holloway and Watts lead their party up to a massive door, sealed tight. In design and scale, undeniably important.
DAVID stands on top of one of the cargo rovers. He's cut a hole in the wall beside the door, high up: he works with probes in the mechanisms inside.
Holloway, Watts, and the crewmen reach the bottom of the ramp, breathing hard. A cargo rover trundles down after them.
Holloway and Watts pass the dead Engineers they discovered the previous day.
A passageway punctuated by alcoves as big as band-shells.
Holloway and Watts round a corner and stop in their tracks.
Glasse presents Watts with his handiwork: her old pair of magnifying goggles, retrofitted with Engineer lenses.
Watts dissects one of the Engineer's eyes - working underwater in a shallow tub of preservative. Glasse looks on avidly, an unabashed fan.
Janek stands at the Bridge window, staring out into the storm. Buffeting clouds and howling winds. The lighthouse beams of the Magellan's beacons sweeping through the cloud.
Janek strides onto the Bridge, Vickers a terrier on his heels. But something in the faces of his men stops him cold.
The surviving complement of the Magellan are holed up on the Bridge: Janek, Glasse, Stillwell, Vickers. The soldiers Shepherd and Ray.
Reporting.
Understood.
No breakfast?
Blood's dry. Eight hours dead or more.
Who's there?
Captain Janek took his crew out to retrieve his missing men. They never came in.
Vigoda. Weyland Security detail.
Director's call to brief you on that.
Haven't been out yet. I understand it's in some kind of pyramid.
We grunts don't know nothing about ships, right?
I kill whatever kills you.
The signs lead here.
Janek drives a cargo rover carrying a search party, flashlight beams sweeping: Stillwell, Glasse, Downs, and Brick. Janek studies an electronic map as he drives.
Watts and Holloway explore a wide colonnade. She is still distracted by the ancient dead; he by the machinery.
Searching, Watts walks anxiously through the dark, sweeping with her light. Shouting for Holloway. She breaks into a run.
Watts, in a space suit, no helmet, opens Holloway's locker.
Glasse seals a nervous-looking Vickers into a vacuum suit.
A hunting party convenes: Card and Vigoda in combat coveralls with submachine guns; Downs, Kamarov and Stillwell wearing tool belts and pistols.
Vigoda, take Kamarov and work the number one accessway. I'll work number three with Downs and Stillwell.
Tactical op.
Who would hang out here?
Watts enters a new chamber, looking around in astonishment.
Watts emerges into a hallway. Leans against the wall, wide-
Watts passes through a circular space with a high domed ceiling. A green glow emanates from grooves in the floor.
The war party passes the empty pilot's seat.
The Sleeper settles into the pilot's chair: it fuses with him, coming alive. A vast display wraps around the walls -
An extraordinary facility.
Watts leads the war party to the Orrery. Momentarily even the soldiers forget their wariness, staring in astonishment at the myriad spheres of light.
The war party pursues the Sleeper - Ray in the lead now, Watts right behind him - DAVID's inert head under her arm.
Watts runs.
The war party moves down a corridor.
Ravel and Chance toil away at the terraforming engine.
GROSS MUSCULAR TRAUMA...
Watts emerges from a lift, jacket pulled tight around her.
So much for sneaking up on him.
On me now. Go. Go.
An immense mausoleum.
Watts rises out of hiding, scanning the room. DAVID ruined.
Watts pounds in futile rage against the door.
